page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The block lies in South Shropshire, east of Ludlow and west of Cleobury Mortimer It is on the eastern slope of Titterstone Clee Hill whose highest point is 533m. Our block falls from a height of 457m to 150m in the South east corner at Hopton Brook. The area divides naturally into two regions Land lying above 300m is chiefly open-common land grazed by free ranging sheep and cattle; dotted by disused tips and quarries where coal, iron and stone have been extracted in former times. The lower land is enclosed in small fields and is chiefly used as pasture land. There are three small villages, Hopton Wafers in the valley and Doddington and Cleeton st Mary further up the hill. There are clusters of houses at Crumps Brook and Hopton Bank
